name: Homewood Suites Miami-Airport / Blue Lagoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked a suite as we were arriving on a evening flight and wanted to set off the next morning. The hotel has a pool and you can have a reasonable breakfast. The suites are like a small flat with all self catering facilities. We had a view over the lagoon. Our intention of having a nice evening was thwarted by US Immigration which were short handed and could not cope with the arrival of a large number of passengers. Our flight arrived at 1830 and, including collecting a car from Alamo, we got out of the airport just before midnight. According to my cousin living in Florida, this is a common problem and appears to be getting worse.
reviews.title: Good location to spend a night close to the airport

reviews.text: The hotel is in decent shape, other than perhaps the pool which seems to fill up with leaves faster than they can clean it.
reviews.title: An Average Property in a Decent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not take advantage of the free breakfast or dinner/drinks offers as I prefer to go out and eat at different restaurants when I travel. But the food smelled and looked ok and there was always a decent crowd.
reviews.title: Great property overlooking a beautiful lake, so unlike an Airport hotel

reviews.text: The room was generally clean and well kept and above average in size. The TVs are newer LG flat panels and the cable works reasonably well. The hotel WiFi also seems to be decent.
reviews.title: Great Hotel close to Miami Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, no major complaints or praises. A reasonable value for a decent property.
reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable

reviews.text: ARRIVAL: We arrived around 3pm and checked in without any wait. They have luggage carts available in the lobby to use. I didn’t receive my Hhonors Gold benefit (2 bottles of water and a package of cookies), but thought nothing of it because some hotels have it waiting in the room, and others deliver it a couple of hours after you check-in. I never received it, so I checked the next day and the reception person was not very friendly. She insisted that if my gold status was on my reservation I would have received it. Well it was on my reservation (shows up when they give me my invoice) and I didn’t. She told me to grab a (one) bottle of water from the little shop. If you are entitled to any free items, please make sure you get them when you check-in. The cost of these items is not much, but I mention this because I think the hotel nickels and dimes you (see safe info below).
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: ROOM: The bathroom was between the living area and the bedroom, and there were doors to each entry. This was good because my sister was on the sofa bed and didn’t need to go into the bedroom to use the bathroom. Also, the toilet and shower were separated from the bathroom sink by a door. The toiletries in the bathroom were Neutrogena brand and consisted of; shampoo, conditioner, lotion and a shower cap. There is a TV in the living area and in the bedroom. Pay Per View movies were available. There is also a VHS player in the living room (yes, VHS). There was a safe in the room that uses a key. You have to go to the front desk to get the key, pay a refundable $15 deposit and pay $1.50 per day to use the safe. I don’t think I have ever paid to use a safe at a Hilton property, even in hotels in New York City. Also, there was nothing that told you this in the room; I went to the front desk asking about the safe key and was told the policy.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean

reviews.text: DINING: The free breakfast buffet was not as good as other Homewood Suites locations. It was enough to save the cost of buying breakfast, but I wouldn’t pay to eat it.
reviews.title: Nice rooms bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION: The hotel is right next to the airport, which is conveniently close, but also loud at times. We were in a room that faced the airport and could hear airplanes occasionally, depending on the runway they used.
reviews.title: Consistent Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night pre-cruise.
reviews.title: Great XP

reviews.text: We are Hilton Honors members and have stayed at several Homewood Suites. I would say this was the most disappointing of the lot, possibly because it is older. It is handy to the airport and there are an assortment of chain restaurants reasonably near by. The shower is good, with good quality towels. Chairs and sofa are comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed for a light supper. It was fun watching/feeding the turtles and fish in the lagoon behind the breakfast lounge.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the bed linens are thin and the mattress not very comfortable (in contrast to a Homewood Suites near us - I would love to buy their mattress). We couldn't shut the bathroom door unless we left the toilet lid seat up, zero clearance otherwise. Internet access was down during our entire stay. The hotel is not well-insulated; you can definitely hear the airplanes across the way. Our bill for a one-bedroom suite for one night was $300 after tax - no way was this hotel worth that much!
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel
Post-Cruise Stay
reviews.text: Convenient location - close the airport, and several restaurants and stores are close by. Parking is free, the suites are nice, and housekeeping was good. The breakfast was not spectacular but ok. It is in a business park, so there isn't much to do in the immediate area if you're in Miami for tourism. I can't say that I was awestruck by this hotel, but I had no complaints about it either. There are definitely worse choices you can make for accommodations in Miami. The suites are very nice for the price; many Miami hotels charge much more for a room than you will pay here for a suite. I had no problems with my stay here and would stay here again.

reviews.title: Good locale, Decent rooms, Bad airport transfer
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel on a Sunday overnight after a cruise. Got a 2 bedroom suite on 5th floor which was nice and clean. Kitchen was quite well equipped and the rooms reasonably spacious. Service was fine as we didn't make very many demands of the staff. Complimentary breakfast was edible with hot food, breads fruits, milk and juices offerred but the cereal selection was limited.
Location was at a fairly quiet end of the airport and wasn't too difficult to find from the airport - we had a rented car.
reviews.title: Very New, Excellent Airport Access

likes.liked: — great staff, great rooms, new and not run down
likes.disliked: — can't think of anything, it far exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: Booked on Tripadvisor recommendation as part of our 3 and half week tour of Florida, we stayed here on our first and last night. This hotel is a gem if you want to just chill out on your first night after a long flight, you don’t even need to go out to eat as the welcome home dinner is fantastic. We expected it to be a snack but it was soup, a salad bar and hot food with free drinks for 2 hours, what more could you ask for the price! The rooms are excellent, nice and comfy and we had a free upgrade on our first night to a 2 bedroom suite which was huge. The hotel is a bit out of the way from everything but we booked it for its convenience to the airport which is a 5 min drive away. SoBe is only a 15 min drive and 2 great malls are the same distance in the other direction. Hotel staff were very helpful and we could not fault anything. The dinning area overlooks the lake as does the pool and there are giant fish which come up to the patio looking for food. The pool and hot tub are good overlooking the lake but you have to put up with the planes overhead because its so near the airport. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel & suite

likes.liked: — Great hotel, great free breakfast & dinner with free drinks for 2 hours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excelent Hotel with clean, comfortable and spacious rooms.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service through highly personable staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Provides free airport shuttle, cable tv, breakfast daily, newspapers and high speed internet access.
reviews.title: Great value huge room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to Miami airport.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night prior to cruising. The hotel shuttle picked us up within 10 minutes, but then did another lap looking for more passengers. Our room was great - small kitchen and living room and a bedroom. Based upon suggestions from the front desk we walked two long blocks (less than 10 minutes) to a strip mall with a grocery store, liquor store, and several dining options.
reviews.title: Great pre-cruise hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was above average for a hotel and we enjoyed the pool and hot-tub for an hour or so before checking out and catching a cab to the port. If you arriving too late to enjoy Miami, and checking out the next day, this is a great place to stay!
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Homewood Suites at Miami Airport's Blue Lagoon was a great spot and we had a pleasant experience there. We had a roomy suite which was very quiet, comfortable and spacious. The hotel van came within ten minutes to pick us up - but note that at the hotel telephone bank in the luggage pick-up area, this Blue Lagoon site has no direct phone line. However, there is a Homewood Suite phone number indicated for one of their other Miami properties, and using this number, they were able to transfer us over to the Blue Lagoon site's front desk to send over the van. One issue to note: this hotel has NO restaurant in the hotel or anywhere nearby (although they had a lovely free breakfast set-up). Thus, you have to eat at the airport or elsewhere before your arrival. HOWEVER, on weeknights they apparently offer a free dinner (one nightly menu per weeknight) to their guests - but the dinner has a narrow timeframe (somewhere around 5:30 to 6:30 pm). We arrived much too late to sample the free dinner. Otherwise, we have no complaints about their very comfortable hotel.
reviews.title: Spacious and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights, Mon to Thurs am. Nice suite, very clean with good kitchen (microwave, dishwasher, fridge, waste disposal). Breakfast good, dinner adequate.
reviews.title: Excellent Pre Cruise Choice

likes.liked: — Staff very friiendly and helpful, room accomidations were more than expected

reviews.text: The one complaint we have is that this is the only hotel we have stayed in where we have been charged to use the in-room safe, this is petty and money -- grabbing.
reviews.title: Comfortable One Night Stay

likes.liked: — Location - close to the airport & free shuttle
likes.disliked: — Location - far from Port of Miami and no free shuttle to the port

reviews.text: This hotel is practically adjacent to the airport so some aircraft noise is inevitable so best to try for a room on the other side.
reviews.title: Usual comfortable property

reviews.text: This is a typical HS property - we always try to stay in a 2 bed/2 bath suite when there are 4 travelling as this presents good value. Breakfasts at these properties are generally a step above the usual basic b/f and this was no exception nice to eat overlooking the lagoon. Not too long to wait for the shuttle and about a 10 min drive.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.text: Good choice for overnight.
reviews.title: A Home away from Home

reviews.text: The Hilton Homewood suites at Miami Blue Lagoon offers the best value for you investment. The price includes excellent room space, a buffet breakfast and excellent buffet in the evening. The Hotel staff is very curteous and helpful, always showing an excellent attitude.
reviews.title: Consistent Quality

reviews.text: We stayed here and it is a home away from home. Great Price and even better value. I would recommend it to any of my family or friends. Also the staff is super helpful when it comes to your needs. A two bedroom suite is a real 2 bedroom suite.
reviews.title: Not exactly value for money

reviews.text: Everything about our stay was excellent except for the airport shuttle. We waited over 45 min for the shuttle. If we knew we would have to wait that long we would have been happy to pay for a cab! The hotel is only about 1 1/2 miles from the airport ...
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms had kitchens, living room, table and chairs , and a seperate bedroom. The hotel served a buffett dinner pasta, salad bar, soup, bread, plus free beer and wine .. it was not too bad like a hospital cafe... They also have a huge breakfast included Dinner and breakfast for 6 in Miami is a huge bonus !
reviews.title: Great Suites at this hotel..!

likes.liked: — the suites, the small store behind the front desk, very confortable hotel

reviews.text: My husband, 3 children, mother-in-law, and I stayed here after our cruise. Compared to the hotel we stayed in before the cruise (beach place towers marriot in ft. lauderdale) the homewood suites was a dump.
reviews.title: Not the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For starters we booked a two bed room suite for privacy and because of the fact that there were 6 of us but the walls are so thin that it wouldn't matter if we were all in the same room or not as far as conversational privacy goes. At night I could hear the people's next to us converstion and they weren't being loud at all, it sounded like normal small talk.
reviews.title: Good Deal

likes.disliked: — They had a group of teenagers dancing in the lobby area/dining room for 5 hours

reviews.text: The next thing is the elevators. Not only do they take forever but the bell sounds like a sick cat and the way it jerks around you've got to wonder when the last time it really had a matinence check was. I tried to look at the certificate inside the elevator but the date was covered by the "frame" they'd put it in.
reviews.title: very nice place

likes.liked: — The large room with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms

reviews.text: Next was the god awfull smell of smoke that permeates the whole place. We were supposed to have been on a non smoking floor but how strong the smell was you couldn't tell.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Having Suites made it so convenient to play games, have your own snacks, and just places to visit. The pool was very nice, but it is nice to have a 1st floor room if you use the pool a lot as the elevators can be VERY SLOW. That was our only complaint though. Food was very good and the beds comfortable.
reviews.title: Had a great family reunion at this hotel.

reviews.text: great location and value, highly recommend especically with families. this hotel had wi fi, breakfast, free transportation from the airport, and a 10 dollar fee to the cruise dock (port of miami) would definitely stay again. plus close to drug stores and grocery for last minute items
reviews.title: great value in miami, picks you up at airport, close to cruise lines, breakfast included, and good location

reviews.text: Nice hotel, the staff is awesome, breakfast & dinner (M-Th), great price for a family of 6! Close to the airport (which is what we needed this trip due to multiple arrival dates), not super deluxe but clean & well maintained.
reviews.title: Great value for a family

reviews.text: Right price, right place, great value. Easy to reach from anywhere in S. Florida although the traffic is a disaster anytime in Miami. Monday thru Thursday - breakfast and dinner buffet included. Staff very courteous and very helpful. Free parking. Lobby a bit noisy when a bunch of tourists with kids are running around. Stayed 5 days - great one bedroom suite (very quiet even though about 500 yards from runway 9R) with all amenities. All in all - great place for business travel. Will definitely stay there again. Be sure to sign up for Hilton Honors program and get points toward free stays.
reviews.title: What a deal...........

reviews.text: We stayed here for an overnight before leaving on a cruise. It was clean, spacious and accommodating. The hotel is dated and in need of some updating. The front desk was very helpful to us in getting transportation to the cruise pier. Breakfast was chaos and can't really be recommended. It leaves you little choice though because there is nothing around to go to.
reviews.title: Ok hotel for an airport layover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at five different hotels in different parts of Florida and this was the best hotel we stayed at. This hotel was a lot better than some of the more expensive hotels we stayed at. We stayed here on the first and last night of our trip because it was close to the airport.
reviews.title: This hotel was great

likes.liked: — Everything was clean; the room was really well equipped; this hotel is really functional

reviews.title: STOLE MY RUM
reviews.text: The room was clean and large and came with a separate bedroom and a living room. The kitchen had a microwave, stove, and was fully equipped with silverware, refrigerator, plates, pots and pans, etc. The hotel itself isn't stunning, but everything is functional and clean - there is a laundry room, a computer room, a small store, and a fitness room. There is a Publix and a strip mall about four blocks away. And all the people at the Front Desk were really nice.
Compared to some of the tired, dirty hotels we stayed at at other places, this one was a gem.
reviews.title: Good enough

reviews.text: We had a very early flight from Miami airport and decided to stay the night at a hotel and leave our car. The suite was very nice and they served breakfast ( we left too early to have it) and a very nice light dinner with wine! The shuttle to the airport at 6 AM was fine and they picked us up at 2AM we we got home. We also got to leave our car in their parking lot for 10 days free. The price was about $125.
reviews.title: What a great experience

reviews.text: Only 1 night before taking a morning flight to JFK. Excellent impression.
reviews.title: Great deal - Huge rooms

reviews.text: After a long flight and standing in rain for a shuttle that never came (my fault, did not know I had to call for it).I finally decided to call hotel, I was very frustrated but the front desk agent promptly apologized, and told me to take a taxi and I would be reimbursed. Arrived at the hotel, was greeted warmly, room keys were ready as well as my taxi fare. Only room available was a smoking room, since I was only going to be there for a few hours, I told them I would try room if they would refresh it, when I entered room there was no scent of smoke, I immediately picked up the phone to tell them it was ok, there was a knock on the door, Danny C was standing there with refresher in hand. I was very impressed with service from him and Michael, they made all my frustrations disappear... Employees like Danny C and Michael help keep the Hilton family hotels at the top.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

reviews.text: Typical Homewood suites, it was clean and the staff were all very friendly and accomodating!
reviews.title: Not a bad place, Price was right

reviews.text: Pros-
reviews.title: Just Right for a Quick Stay

reviews.text: It was cheaper than most the hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Still There

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a free reception and meal Monday-thrusday!
reviews.title: Not WORTH IT AT ALL

aka: Homewood Suites Miami-Airport / Blue Lagoon Hotel Miami
